SEARCH
Package Pages

Class TravelAgentAccountPage

java.lang.Object
Pages.TravelAgentAccountPage
public class TravelAgentAccountPage extends Object
The TravelAgentAccountPage class in the Pages package is dedicated to creating and managing the user interface components for travel agents.

This class consists of static methods that generate different panels and tabs designed for travel agent activities.

Key functionalities and features provided by this class include:

  • Generating a tabbed pane that organizes various travel agent-related tasks into distinct tabs. This includes tabs for room management, guest reservation booking, and account options.
  • Creating panels that allow agents to add and modify room details, book reservations on behalf of guests, and update their account information.
  • Implementing dialog boxes for modifying room attributes and adding new rooms to a cruise

  • Method Details

    • createTravelAgentViewTabbedPane

      public static JTabbedPane createTravelAgentViewTabbedPane(JFrame frame)
      Initializes and returns a JTabbedPane tailored for the travel agent interface.

      This method constructs a JTabbedPane with multiple tabs, each dedicated to a specific function relevant to travel agents. The tabs are designed to facilitate various aspects of cruise booking and account management. The following tabs are included:

      • 'Manage Rooms' tab: Uses 'createAddRoomPanel'. This tab allows agents to add new rooms to the system and manage existing ones.
      • 'Book For Guest' tab: Uses 'createReserveForGuestPanel'. This tab enables agents to make bookings on behalf of guests.
      • 'Account Options' tab: Uses 'createModifyAccountPanel'. This tab provides functionalities for agents to modify their account settings and includes logout capabilities.

      Each tab is appropriately labeled and comes with a tooltip offering a brief description of its purpose and functionality.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame in which this tabbed pane is to be integrated
      Returns:
      a fully-configured JTabbedPane designed specifically to cater to the various tasks and responsibilities of travel agents

    • createAddRoomPanel

      public static JPanel createAddRoomPanel(JFrame frame)
      Creates and returns a panel designed for adding and managing rooms on different cruises.

      This panel is structured with a GridBagLayout and includes several key components to facilitate room management for travel agents:

      • A JComboBox to select from a list of available cruises. This component allows agents to choose a specific cruise for which they intend to manage room allocations.
      • A JList displayed within a JScrollPane, showing a list of rooms associated with the selected cruise. This list updates dynamically based on the selected cruise.
      • 'Add Room' and 'Modify Room' buttons. The 'Add Room' button launches a dialog for adding new rooms to the cruise, while the 'Modify Room' button opens a dialog for editing details of an existing room.

      The panel is specifically for travel agents, allowing manage and update room availability across various cruises.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame used for displaying dialogs and managing interactive actions related to room management
      Returns:
      a JPanel used for adding and modifying rooms on cruises

    • createReserveForGuestPanel

      public static JPanel createReserveForGuestPanel(JFrame frame)
      Constructs and returns a panel that enables travel agents to make room reservations for guests.

      This panel is designed to assist travel agents in booking reservations on behalf of guests. It includes:

      • A JComboBox to select a cruise from a set of predefined options ("CRUISE1", "CRUISE2", "CRUISE3"). This allows the agent to specify the cruise for which the reservation is being made.
      • A JList displayed within a JScrollPane, showcasing a list of guests. This list is retrieved from 'GuestController.getGuestList()' and is used by the agent to select the guest for whom the reservation is being made.
      • A 'Book Reservation' button that, when clicked, initiates the reservation process for the selected guest on the chosen cruise.

      The guest list is presented in the JList using a custom cell renderer, which displays each guest's username for easy identification. On selecting a guest and clicking the 'Book Reservation' button, the panel transitions to the 'Guest View' interface, pre-loaded with the selected guest's details.

      The layout of the panel is organized using a GridBagLayout, with GridBagConstraints.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame in which this panel is to be displayed
      Returns:
      a JPanel designed for travel agents to facilitate the booking of reservations on behalf of guests

    • createModifyAccountPanel

      public static JPanel createModifyAccountPanel(JFrame frame)
      Creates and returns a panel that allows travel agents to modify their account information.

      This panel is for travel agents to update their account details. It provides a coherent layout using a GridBagLayout . The fields for account information are pre-filled with the current agent's data.

      Key features of the panel include:

      • Text fields for the username, password, and address, pre-populated with the agent's existing information.
      • An 'Update' button, which on clicking, saves the changes made to the account. This process includes a check for username availability and updates the account through 'modifyTravelAgentAccount'.
      • A 'Logout' button, which facilitates the agent's logout process and transitions back to the login panel.
      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame used for displaying dialogs and managing actions
      Returns:
      a JPanel dedicated to enabling account modifications for travel agents
